svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
December 2, 2023" date: "2023-12-01"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
Devnet-12 launched, likely to run over holidays, Prysm expect to join in ~2 weeks
Upgrade process discussion: upgrade documents in PM repo, meta EIPs for each upgrade
and considered for inclusion (CFI) label
Latest all core devs â€“ consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
* Devnet-12 launched, likely to run over holidays, Prysm expect to join in ~2 weeks
* Upgrade process discussion: upgrade documents in PM repo, meta EIPs for each upgrade
* Dencun interop testing call video
Dencun interop testing call video
Prague + Electra upgrade
* Upgrade meta discussion : community input into which features (EIPs) to include
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.28% increasing towards 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 32.28% increasing towards 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~84%
supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm 41% &
Lighthouse 34%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth ~84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm 41% & Lighthouse 34%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean
loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm 41% & Lighthouse 34%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss
of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Layer 1
* Timing games are bad for Ethereum P2P.org (Lido founders) are delaying requests up
to 1 second to increase MEV
Timing games are bad for Ethereum
* P2P.org (Lido founders) are delaying requests up to 1 second to increase MEV
* Pari (EF DevOps): how to create a shadow fork
Pari (EF DevOps): how to create a shadow fork
* Verkle implementers call notes
Verkle implementers call notes
* Guide to join Verkle testnet (verkle-gen-devnet-2)
Guide to join Verkle testnet (verkle-gen-devnet-2)
For Stakers
* Dappnode MEV smoothing pool for solo stakers
Dappnode MEV smoothing pool for solo stakers
* Obol (distributed validators) live, beta, clusters capped at 1 validator
Obol (distributed validators) live, beta, clusters capped at 1 validator
* Lighthouse user experience survey
Lighthouse user experience survey
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Nimbus v23.11.0 : Obol enhanced support, improved scoring
algorithms to maximize block rewards with multiple beacon nodes, simple bootstrapping
and performance improvements for 10k+ validators on a single machine
Consensus layer:
* Nimbus v23.11.0 : Obol enhanced support, improved scoring algorithms to maximize
block rewards with multiple beacon nodes, simple bootstrapping and performance
improvements for 10k+ validators on a single machine
* Execution layer: Reth v0.1.0-alpha.12 : support Canyon upgrade on OP Stack networks
(not OP mainnet) and fix for pruned node operators
Execution layer:
* Reth v0.1.0-alpha.12 : support Canyon upgrade on OP Stack networks (not OP mainnet)
and fix for pruned node operators
Research
* Barnabe: Liquefaction , semantics of liquid staking
Barnabe: Liquefaction , semantics of liquid staking
* Chipmunk : synchronized lattice-based multi-signature scheme, plausibly secure
against quantum attacks
Chipmunk : synchronized lattice-based multi-signature scheme, plausibly secure against
quantum attacks
Layer 2
* RollupCodes : opcodes, precompiles & system contracts for each rollup
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs Meta EIP7568 : Hardfork meta backfill - Berlin to Shapella Meta EIP7569 :
Hardfork meta - Dencun
EIPs
* Meta EIP7568 : Hardfork meta backfill - Berlin to Shapella
Meta EIP7568 : Hardfork meta backfill - Berlin to Shapella
* Meta EIP7569 : Hardfork meta - Dencun
Meta EIP7569 : Hardfork meta - Dencun
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7565 : Perpetual contract NFTs as collateral for
liquidity provision ERC7566 : Multiplayer onchain game ERC7567 : Splitable utility NFT
extension for ERC721
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7565 : Perpetual contract NFTs as collateral for liquidity provision
ERC7565 : Perpetual contract NFTs as collateral for liquidity provision
* ERC7566 : Multiplayer onchain game
ERC7566 : Multiplayer onchain game
* ERC7567 : Splitable utility NFT extension for ERC721
ERC7567 : Splitable utility NFT extension for ERC721
Stuff for developers
* Testnets: Goerli is deprecated : client teams & EF will exit validators 3 months
after upgrading to Dencun (or 1 month after mainnet Dencun upgrade if later) Sepolia :
use for application layer testing HoleÅ¡ky : use for staking & infrastructure testing
OP testnets migrating to OP Sepolia from OP Goerli
Testnets:
* Goerli is deprecated : client teams & EF will exit validators 3 months after
upgrading to Dencun (or 1 month after mainnet Dencun upgrade if later)
Goerli is deprecated : client teams & EF will exit validators 3 months after upgrading
to Dencun (or 1 month after mainnet Dencun upgrade if later)
* Sepolia : use for application layer testing
Sepolia : use for application layer testing
* HoleÅ¡ky : use for staking & infrastructure testing
HoleÅ¡ky : use for staking & infrastructure testing
* OP testnets migrating to OP Sepolia from OP Goerli
* OpenZeppelin Contracts wizard adds AI assistant to update code & answer questions,
alpha
OpenZeppelin Contracts wizard adds AI assistant to update code & answer questions,
* Wake (previously Woke): Python based Solidity dev framework with vulnerability
detectors
Wake (previously Woke): Python based Solidity dev framework with vulnerability
* EVMole : extract function selectors from bytecode, Python & JavaScript
implementations
EVMole : extract function selectors from bytecode, Python & JavaScript implementations
* OP Wagmi : wagmi v2 style hooks to interact with OP Stack networks
OP Wagmi : wagmi v2 style hooks to interact with OP Stack networks
* Coinbase build onchain apps starter kit: RainbowKit, wagmi, Next.js & Tailwind CSS
Coinbase build onchain apps starter kit: RainbowKit, wagmi, Next.js & Tailwind CSS
* CTFs: Ethernaut reforged : solve & submit first 8 challenges using just Foundry
Curta CTF adds writeups
CTFs:
* Ethernaut reforged : solve & submit first 8 challenges using just Foundry
Ethernaut reforged : solve & submit first 8 challenges using just Foundry
* Curta CTF adds writeups
* Crypto data advent calendar : data ecosystem project featured each day
Crypto data advent calendar : data ecosystem project featured each day
Security
* KyberSwap plan treasury grants for affected users Elastic exploiter demands to take
over the company
KyberSwap plan treasury grants for affected users
* Elastic exploiter demands to take over the company
* Curve price oracle usage
Curve price oracle usage
Ecosystem
* ~15% of transactions via private transaction pools
~15% of transactions via private transaction pools
* Data visualization of where all ETH sits onchain
Data visualization of where all ETH sits onchain
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 14.7 to 185.0 gwei, with 34.8 gwei average Zero
net issuance currently at 21.8 gwei 9.8k ETH net burn this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 14.7 to 185.0 gwei, with 34.8 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 21.8 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 21.8 gwei
* 9.8k ETH net burn this week
9.8k ETH net burn this week
* ETHUSD : $1,994 - $2,111, currently $2,084
ETHUSD : $1,994 - $2,111, currently $2,084
* ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* StakeWise v3 live on mainnet, marketplace of staking offers, node operators &
stakers can mint LSD
StakeWise v3 live on mainnet, marketplace of staking offers, node operators & stakers
can mint LSD
* Paradigm distances itself from Blast (despite being lead investor twice for this
founder)
Paradigm distances itself from Blast (despite being lead investor twice for this
* Gitcoin Grants 19 completed, $600k donated, 45k donors
Gitcoin Grants 19 completed, $600k donated, 45k donors
* American Cancer Society Gitcoin grants round on Arbitrum
American Cancer Society Gitcoin grants round on Arbitrum
Job Listings
* Aragon: Senior smart contract developer w EIP, auditing experience
Aragon: Senior smart contract developer w EIP, auditing experience
* Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
* Enya Labs: Lead Security Engineer , Sr. Fullstack Dev (with Go exp), BizDev
Enya Labs: Lead Security Engineer , Sr. Fullstack Dev (with Go exp), BizDev
* Nethermind: Lead Software Engineer , BizDev & CTO
Nethermind: Lead Software Engineer , BizDev & CTO
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* Circle denies baseless Elizabeth Warren claims on illicit financing & banking Justin
Sun
Circle denies baseless Elizabeth Warren claims on illicit financing & banking Justin
* SIM Swapper sentenced to 8 years prison
SIM Swapper sentenced to 8 years prison
General
* Vitalik: techno-optimism , d/acc (defensive/decentralization/differential
acceleration)
Vitalik: techno-optimism , d/acc (defensive/decentralization/differential
* BSC: bsc-geth bug , bsc-erigon unable to sync
BSC: bsc-geth bug , bsc-erigon unable to sync
* Polygon POS proposal to increase max contract size from 24kb to 32kb
Polygon POS proposal to increase max contract size from 24kb to 32kb
* Velodrome & Aerodrome domains were compromised in social engineering attack on
provider
Velodrome & Aerodrome domains were compromised in social engineering attack on
* Twitter 15 minute security self-audit
Twitter 15 minute security self-audit
* BLUFFS : Bluetooth MitM attack reusing a weak session key
BLUFFS : Bluetooth MitM attack reusing a weak session key
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the weekâ€™s news in real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-december-2-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Dec 4 â€“ ETHVenice
Dec 4 â€“ ETHVenice
* Dec 6-7 â€“ Columbia CryptoEconomics workshop (New York)
Dec 6-7 â€“ Columbia CryptoEconomics workshop (New York)
* Dec 7 â€“ Optimismâ€™s RetroPGF 3 voting ends (support Week in Ethereum News )
Dec 7 â€“ Optimismâ€™s RetroPGF 3 voting ends (support Week in Ethereum News )
* Dec 7-10 â€“ ETHGlobal Pragma & ETHIndia (Bangalore)
Dec 7-10 â€“ ETHGlobal Pragma & ETHIndia (Bangalore)
* Jan 15 â€“ EFâ€™s Next Billion fellowship cohort 4 deadline
Jan 15 â€“ EFâ€™s Next Billion fellowship cohort 4 deadline
* Feb 2-4 â€“ ETH Cinco de Mayo hackathon (Cholula, Puebla)
